We have a circuit with a capacitor and a resistor driven by an independent voltage source with a voltage that is a function of time \(V(t)\).
The resistance of the resistor is \(R\Omega\) and the capacitance of the capacitor is \(C\)F.
Suppose the drive \(V\) rises in a step from \(0\)V to \($VI\)V at the initial time \(t=0\). Also suppose that the capacitor's initial voltage \(v_C(0) = 0\)V.
In the space provided below write an algebraic expression for the capacitor voltage as a function of time, \(v_C(t)\) for \(t > 0\).
Now, suppose the drive falls in a step from \($VI\)V to \(0\)V at the initial time \(t=0\). Also suppose that the capacitor's initial voltage \(v_C(0) = $VI\)V.
In the space provided below write an algebraic expression for the capacitor voltage as a function of time, \(v_C(t)\) for \(t > 0\).
